Name: Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology
Overview:
Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology (GMIT) is a prestigious institute located in Galway, Ireland, offering a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in diverse fields to both international and domestic students, including online degree programs for distance education. The university has varying cost of attendance depending on the course, with an average tuition and fees, excluding other expenses, around 10,92,725 INR for international students, slightly more than that for local students. To help students finance their education, GMIT provides scholarships, work-study programs, and funding opportunities based on merit and performance.

According to Emolument, GMIT's alumni and graduates specializing in Logistics, Operations, and Purchasing are the highest paid, earning an impressive $84,000 annually. In addition to academic excellence, the university also prioritizes students' career development with the help of its dedicated Career Planning Service team. This team assists students in creating a strong resume and finding suitable job opportunities, be it post-graduation or part-time, summer, or internship positions. With GMIT's excellent reputation and extensive support system, students can pave the way for a successful and fulfilling career.
Eligibility Overview: Ordinary Bachelor Degree (Level 7) and Higher Certificate (Level 6):All Higher Certificates (Level 6) and ab initio Bachelor degrees (Level 7) have a minimum Leaving Certificate entry requirement of Grade O6/H7 or better in five Leaving Certificate subjects, including Mathematics and English or Irish, with a minimum of 160 points. Bachelor's Degrees with Honours (Level 8):A Grade O6/H7 or above in six Leaving Certificate courses, including English or Irish and Mathematics, is the standard minimum entry requirement, two of which must be passed in higher-level papers at Grade H5 or higher.Click on this link-https://www.gmit.ie/study/apply-to-gmit/irisheu-students/cao-student/entry-requirements
Accommodation: Off-campus accommodation The average rent is 550 to 650 Euros/monthThe residence type includes studio apartments, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartmentsEach student apartment has a washer and dryer machine which ensures they don't have to pay extra for tokens for central laundry facilitiesMany of the student accommodation is located beside Corrib shopping center in the heart of Galway city

Name: Maynooth University
Overview: Maynooth University (MU) is a part of the National University of Ireland located in Maynooth, County Kildare, just 25 km from Dublin, Ireland. The university consists of two connected campuses, one in the north and the other in the south. Approximately 13,000 students from over 20 countries, along with 900 faculty members, are a part of MU. It offers a wide range of programs, including 235 undergraduate and postgraduate courses, in 26 departments and three faculties. Popular fields of study include Social Science, Humanities, and Natural Sciences. MU is home to several research institutions, such as the Irish Climate Analysis and Research Units (ICARUS), the Institute of Immunology, the National Institute for Regional and Spatial Analysis, The Callan Institute, and the National Centre for Geocomputation. On-campus housing options are available for registered full-time students in five different residences, namely The Courtyard Plaza, The Courtyard Apartment, The River Apartment, The Village Apartment, and The Rye Hall. With over 100 student clubs and societies, like rugby, badminton, tennis, surfing, canoeing, archery, and kayaking, students have a wide range of extracurriculars to choose from. Additionally, MU has strong ties with industry giants such as Google, Microsoft, Facebook, IBM, Intel, HP, Coca-Cola, Cadbury, Goldman Sachs, L'oreal, and Unilever. The average annual tuition fee for undergraduate programs is around USD 13,700, while that for postgraduate programs is approximately USD 14,800. The university offers over 60 scholarships, including the MU Entrance Scholarships, MU Sports Scholarships, and the Google Women Techmakers Undergraduate Scholar Award worth USD 1000, for students in need of financial aid.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: Indian Undergraduate Applicants' Eligibility Requirements Higher Secondary Grade 12 School Certificate  provided by the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) or Indian Cert of Secondary Education with a minimum overall score of 75% and an English score of 70%. (ICSE)All India Secondary School Certificate (Grade 12) or equivalent scoresAll other boards demand a 75% English scoreThe minimum age for students is 18 English Language Proficiency International students should submit one of the following English language proficiency test scores:   Indian Graduate Applicants' Eligibility Requirements Academic requirements: International graduates who want to enrol in postgraduate courses must have a bachelor's degree that is comparable to an Irish bachelor's degree. Indian graduates must score at least 55% in business degree programmes, and at least 60% in other graduate programmes English Language Proficiency International students should submit one of the following English language proficiency test scores:

Students are recruited by top companies such as Google, Accenture, Bank of Ireland, Cadbury, Citigroup, Coca-Cola, Facebook, Goldman Sachs, HSBC, IBM, Intel, JP Morgan Chase & Co, Loreal, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, Unilever, Zurich Financial Services, and many others after they complete their graduation.

Name: Trinity College Dublin, the University of Dublin
Overview:
Established in 1592, Trinity College Dublin is one of the oldest institutions in Ireland. With a rich history and prestigious reputation, the university attracts over 18,000 students from 122 countries worldwide. Trinity College offers a diverse range of programs, including more than 600 undergraduate, postgraduate, short courses, and online courses. The university is renowned for its high-quality education in fields such as Law, Literature and Humanities, Health Sciences, and STEM subjects.

Trinity College Dublin has a competitive acceptance rate of 34% and all applications are accepted through the online application portal along with a fee of 55 EUR. In addition to the application, students are required to submit their academic transcripts, IELTS/TOEFL scores, Letters of Recommendation, and a course-specific CV/resume. The campus itself covers 51 acres and boasts stunning Georgian architecture, impressive museums, art galleries, and theatres.

The Trinity Library is a highlight of the campus with over 6 million printed volumes, making it the largest library in Ireland. The university is also home to the Business School, Science Gallery, the Long Room Hub Institute for Arts and Humanities, The Lir Academy for Dramatic Art, the nanoscience research center (CRANN), and the Biomedical Sciences Institute. Tuition fees for international students range from USD 28,000 to 56,000 per year.

Financial aid options are available for students, such as the Global Business Scholarship and Postgraduate Research Scholarship. There is also the opportunity to apply for the government of Ireland Scholarship, which offers a 100% tuition fee waiver. Accommodation is provided at the Trinity Hall, which can cater to over 1,000 students in shared, single, or twin apartments. Alternatively, students can opt for off-campus housing at Kavanagh Court and Binary Hub. The average price of rooms is USD 205 per week, and the average cost of living for a year is around USD 13,800.

In addition to its academic offerings, Trinity College offers over 170 societies and sports clubs for students to engage in. These include hockey, rowing, investing, advocacy, animation, and zoology. With its location in the heart of Ireland's Silicon Valley, the university boasts an impressive 92% employment rate. Alumni have gone on to work for top companies such as Google, Facebook, Microsoft, PayPal, LinkedIn, Airbnb, and eBay.
Eligibility Overview: All applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English. The following qualifications are accepted/permitted: 1 Irish Leaving Certificate: an ordinary level English mark of 6 or better. 2 GCSE: English Language with a C or above. 3 US High School: English grade of C in senior year.6.5 on the IELTS (academic version) (no individual band below 6)IELTS (academic version) 7 (no individual band below 7) for dental coursesIELTS (academic version) 7 for Clinical Speech and Language Studies (no individual band below 7) A minimum score of 63on the Pearson Test of English (Academic) - PTE Academic (with no Communication Skills section score below 59) is requiredEnglish A1, A2, or B: 5 at Higher Level in the International Baccalaureate (4 at Standard Level if presenting IB through English)
Accommodation: On-campus housing is located in the heart of the city, in either historic buildings in the centre of the university or more modern structures further east. Trinity's historic campus offers students a one-of-a-kind and unforgettable housing experience in the magnificent surroundings of the 400-year-old universityfor more detail click on this llink-https://www.tcd.ie/accommodation/on-campus/

Name: EDUCO- Technological University Dublin
Overview: Technological University Dublin is the first technological university in Ireland, formed through the amalgamation of three existing institutes of technology in the Dublin region: Dublin Institute of Technology, Institute of Technology Blanchardstown, and Institute of Technology Tallaght. The university's five primary campuses are located in Grangegorman, Aungier Street, Bolton Street, Blanchardstown, and Tallaght, serving the greater Dublin area. These campuses are home to an impressive variety of student-run societies and clubs, including sports like Gaelic Athletic Association, soccer, handball, powerlifting, archery, rowing, skiing, basketball, kite surfing, and cricket. The university boasts a substantial student population of over 28,500 and a dedicated faculty of 3,000, with a focus on computer science and STEM-based subjects. Popular courses at TU Dublin include Product Design, Mechanical Engineering, Architecture, Engineering, Science, Marketing, Hospitality, Music, Optometry, Pharmaceuticals, Construction, Digital Media, and Journalism. The Career Development Centre at TU Dublin assists students in securing employment opportunities with top companies like Accenture, Ernst and Young, Deloitte, Microsoft, Google, and Amazon. When it comes to accommodation, students have the option of living with a host family, staying in a student accommodation hub, or renting private housing through TU Dublin's StudentPad service. The estimated cost of living at TU Dublin is approximately EUR 12,000 per year, while tuition fees range from EUR 10,000 to EUR 12,500. Students can apply for financial aid through various scholarships, such as the Government of Ireland Scholarships and the Centenary Scholarships for International Students.

QualificationMinimum Grade

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

HSC XII

 

Standard XI will not meet TU Dublin's minimum requirements. Applicants with these qualifications must complete a recognized Foundation program. 

Successful completion of HSC XII

  • HSC XII: CBSE, ICSE, Kolkata or Tamil Nadu boards with an overall average of 70% or above.
  • HSC XII: West Bengal board with an overall average of 58% or above.
  • HSC XII: Maharashtra or Gujarat boards with an overall average of 75% or above.
  • HSC XII: All other state boards with an overall average of 80%+ or above

or

Successful completion of Standard XI with 55% OR successful completion of Standard XII 50% plus successful completion of TU Dublin Foundation or another recognised pre-university foundation with relevant subjects and 60% - 65%

or

Successful completion of 1 year of an Indian degree with an average of 55% with relevant subjects at a recognised third-level or higher education institution in addition to completion of senior high school. This assessment will be on a case-by-case basis.

Additional Requirements

  • Where Maths is required for a specific degree programme, a minimum grade of 75% is required in Maths, 80% is required for Engineering/Computing/Science programme.
  • Where a Lab Science subject is required for a specific degree programme, a minimum grade of 80% is required in a Lab Science subject
Placement: Work placement is an essential component of TU Dublin's higher education programs. It provides students with the opportunity to apply what they have learned, continue to develop new practice-based skills, and gain an awareness of what is expected of them in the profession, in our opinion.Employers benefit from chances to create research partnerships, recruit graduates, and collaborate with a Higher Education Institute on knowledge transfer and the creation of employable graduates.Work placement is a three-way collaboration between the company, the higher education institution, and the student. It allows companies to find a valuable source of competent labor for their company or organization and a pipeline for future recruitment needs.

Name: University College Cork
Overview:
With its inception dating back to 1845, the University College Cork is a prestigious research institution located in Cork, Ireland. The university boasts of seven faculties, each offering a wide range of academic programs. These include Commerce, Engineering, Arts and Celtic Studies, Medicine, Science, Law, and Food Science. To streamline the academic process, the university is divided into four colleges, namely the College of Business and Law, the College of Arts, Celtic Studies and Social Sciences, the College of Medicine and Health, and the College of Science, Engineering and Food Science. The university's student body comprises more than 21,000 students, who carry out their academics in a world-class educational infrastructure spread across 42 acres of land. Some noteworthy buildings at the university include the Alfred O'Rahilly building, the Cavanagh Pharmacy building, the Brookfield Health Science Center, the Bio Green Café, the Lewis Glucksman Gallery, and the Boole Library. Moreover, the university features an impressive array of 50 active sports clubs and over 100 societies, catering to diverse interests such as gaming, politics, social causes, religion, martial arts, water sports, and other athletic pursuits. 

Admission to the University College Cork is strictly based on academic merit, which is determined by scores in language proficiency tests. The accepted tests are IELTS (6.5 and above), TOEFL (90 and above), and PTE (63 and above). Prospective students are also required to submit an admission fee of 50 EUR. The university offers a plethora of undergraduate and postgraduate programs, with a tuition range of 16,000 EUR to 22,000 EUR and 14,000 EUR to 20,000 EUR, respectively. To make quality education accessible to all, the university provides various financial aid options, including loans, bursaries, and scholarships. Some of the notable scholarships offered by the university are CACSSS Excellence Scholarship, SEFS Postgraduate and Undergraduate Scholarship, and Quercus Masters Scholarship for all disciplines. 

For students looking for on-campus residence options, the university offers six well-maintained residential complexes, namely Victoria Lodge, University Hall, Mardyke Hall, Victoria Mills, Castlewhite Apartments, and Aras Ui Thuama. To secure a spot, a booking deposit of 300 EUR needs to be paid. These accommodation facilities feature various room options, including Single, En Suite, Twin, and Single Ensuite rooms, to cater to different requirements. The average cost of living in university accommodation is around 6,100 EUR, which covers amenities like a fitted kitchen, TV, internet connection, laundry, wardrobe, enclosed parking area, and more. With an impressive graduate employment rate of 90%, students of University College Cork receive attractive job offers with an average salary package ranging from 71,000 USD to 90,000 USD.

Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University College Cork include Centenary Scholarship Msc Marketing,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University ,Doris Dixon Scholarship,University Of Calgary International Entrance Award.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University College Cork is the post-study work opportunities in Ireland. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University College Cork has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Griffith College - Dublin
Overview:
Griffith College, established in 1974, is a distinguished private third-level institute located in Dublin, Ireland. Its main campus in Dublin, as well as the additional campuses in Cork and Limerick, boast state-of-the-art facilities.

The college offers a wide range of programs in various faculties, including Journalism and Media Communications, Teaching and Learning, Design, Business, Engineering, Professional Accountancy, Law, Lifelong Learning, Music and Multimedia, Pharmaceutical Science, Professional Law, and Counselling & Psychotherapy, as well as Computing. With over 7,400 students enrolled in 190+ undergraduate, postgraduate, international, professional, and short-term courses, there are options for both full-time and part-time study, as well as blended and online learning.

Prospective international students with IELTS or TOEFL certifications can easily come and study at Griffith College by filling out an online application form and paying an Academic Administration fee of 250 EUR. For postgraduate programs, the tuition fee is 14,000 EUR, while it is 12,000 EUR for undergraduate programs. Additionally, there is an application fee of 300 EUR. Average per night accommodation rates range from 23- 46 EUR, with off-campus options available for a monthly rent of 500- 700 EUR.

To support its diverse student body, Griffith College offers two forms of financial assistance: the Griffith College Dublin Bursary and the Academic Merit Scholarship. Upon graduation, students can expect to secure well-paying jobs with an average annual salary between 45,000- 65,000 USD, thanks to the college's placement assistance program. With its comprehensive programs and array of support services, Griffith College is a prime destination for students seeking quality education in Ireland.
Eligibility Overview: English Language RequirementsInternational applicants must meet English language standards.If you have completed previous studies in a language other than English, you may be required to take an English language test to indicate that you have met the English language requirements for your degree.You may be exempt if you have already studied in English. As part of your application, your eligibility will be evaluated.Check here for more details: https://www.griffith.edu.au/apply/international/understanding-entry-requirements#:~:text=English%20language%20requirements%20apply%20to,English%20you%20may%20be%20exempt.
Accommodation: Housing at GriffithOn a lovely 7-acre site in the heart of Dublin city, Griffith College Halls of Residence (GHR) provides students with a safe, secure, and private living place. Built in 2004, this purpose-built environment provides a comfortable and convenient lodging choice, especially for people who live outside of the capital.Our 24/7 security crew patrols the campus on a regular basis and is available to assist any GHR resident who requires assistance at any time.In the Dublin rental market, GHR is also relatively affordable. All costs are included in our fee, including water, electricity, heating, and Wi-Fi, subject to a fair usage policy.Check: https://www.griffith.ie/offices/accommodation
